header.title: The Catechism of Lucifer
header.category: Western Esotericism, Luciferianism, Left Hand Path Occultism

central_thesis: The central thesis of 'The Catechism of Lucifer' is the philosophical and practical articulation of Luciferian gnosis as a Left Hand Path to spiritual liberation and self-deification. It advocates for the transcendence of material limitations, conventional morality, and dogmatic religion through the worship of the absolute, monistic Spirit (often personified as Satan/Lucifer), the embrace of Sacred Darkness, and a rigorous process of internal purification and occult development aimed at realizing one's inner divinity and achieving 'super-humanity.' The book posits that true spiritual progress comes from rejecting external authorities and societal constructs, embracing suffering as a catalyst, and consciously directing one's will and intellect in accordance with the laws of the invisible world to achieve the 'Great Work' of becoming one with the Master and the Uncreated Abyss.

structure_content.chapter_title: For the Reader
structure_content.summary: This section outlines the book's purpose: to invoke thought rather than enforce dogma, emphasizing the freedom of the spiritual Ego in Luciferian gnosis. It states the book is about 'theosophical Luciferianism' and encourages liberation through its tenets rather than imprisonment by them.

structure_content.chapter_title: Preface to the English version
structure_content.summary: The author notes the daring nature of the translation, explaining that the original Finnish edition mocked the Evangelical Lutheran catechism. This confrontational form might lose its original impact in English but aims to guide readers to discern wisdom and truth, rejecting folly. It reaffirms Master Lucifer-Christos and the Sacred Triple Key.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Ten Commandments
structure_content.summary: This section introduces ten core anti-nomian principles for Luciferian practice: Hate God, Honor Satan, Sanctify Darkness, Hate Mother and Father, Purify Hate, Purify Lust, Hate Life, Abandon Lies, Worship Death, and Despise Humanity. These commandments are presented as a path of wisdom for the brave and proud, leading to strength and truth in a 'distorted world.'

structure_content.chapter_title: The First Commandment: Hate God, worship the Spirit alone
structure_content.summary: The book rejects the 'Christian God' as tyrannical and contradictory, defining the 'fear of God' as selfishness. It advocates worship of the 'monistic, absolute Spirit' as the eternal source of all Meaning, Truth, Love, Will, and Strength, which manifests in the 'Uncreated Abyss' and one's own being.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Second Commandment: Above All, Honor Satan, the Inner Master
structure_content.summary: Satan is presented as an elevating force, the 'holy archangel' who elevates mankind from ignorance, born of Spirit, and a 'disclaimer' to tyranny. His 'fall' is allegorical of purity. Master Satan is equated with man's 'inner ideal image,' an 'individualised fragment of deep Knowledge and Power' residing in the Abyss, to be rediscovered through occult development. Satan is also identified with Azazel, the Son who allows the Father (Abyss) to be seen.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Third Commandment: Sanctify Darkness, see the imperfection in all forms
structure_content.summary: This commandment rejects the idea of capturing spirit's holiness in form, asserting that forms are instrumental and vulnerable to corruption. 'Sacred Darkness' is the only 'unspoiled reality' and true Meaning. The Sanskrit 'Sat' (ever-existence) and 'Asat' (illusionary nature of form) are discussed, with the letter 'Nun' (Ichthys, Dagon) representing the 'Eye of the Master,' the crossing point where 'Asat' and 'Nun' become 'ANSAT' (Satan). The purpose of ritualistic instruments is to mediate truth, not embody spirit.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fourth Commandment: Hate Your Mother and Your Father so that you may follow the Truth
structure_content.summary: This commandment calls for transcending conformist ethics and familial/societal bonds to achieve spiritual truth. It argues that parents provide only outer features, and true devotion is owed to the spirit that expects nothing. The concept of 'killing the father' is framed as a necessary step for individuation and becoming the 'father' in a wider, non-separatist sense, where all beings are interconnected in spirit.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fifth Commandment: Purify the Hate, abandon the violence that binds to form
structure_content.summary: Genuine pride and respect for the Ego are affirmed, but material selfishness is rejected. Hate is to be directed at the 'false government of the world and its blind creator,' not through physical violence, which is seen as 'materialism' and 'blindness.' Purified hate, expressed through disciplined thought, has the power to 'sculpt matter from above,' targeting the 'true source of suffering and crudeness' (the Creator) rather than mere messengers.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Sixth Commandment: Purify the Lust, abandon form-breeding sexuality
structure_content.summary: Sexual lust is seen as prolonging material life and is one of the 'most primitive manifestations' of productive life. While physical sexuality leads to an endless cycle of birth and decay, a 'sublimated sexual drive' becomes a 'magical and controlled ability' for the soul. 'Emotionally impure sexuality' and procreation for worldly ends are considered 'sins' (within the book's redefinition) that bind to form, while spiritualized lust is a delicate effort for abolishing the world of forms.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Seventh Commandment: Hate Life, see the vanity in all Creation
structure_content.summary: 'Life' is described as 'limited shreds of formal tissue' and a product of the 'Creator, the great deceiver,' echoing Gnostic concepts of a blind demiurge. The 'bliss of perdition' (eternal sleep of perfection) is disrupted by creation. Happiness sought in this 'humiliated state' of physical/psychological rule is an illusion. True reality lies in the spirit, beyond the 'loathsome' forms and 'poisonous table scraps' of temporal pleasure.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eighth Commandment: Abandon the lies of faith and hope, seek and speak but the truth
structure_content.summary: Blind faith and hope are rejected as 'treacherous dreams' that offer false relief from the hopelessness of one's state of being, rather than a solution to ideological dilemmas. True faith is in 'knowledge' and earned achievement, not privilege. Man's resurrection comes from his own 'natural process of development,' not an 'outer God.' Lying, deceit, and cunning are deemed 'pettiness unfit for the human soul,' as 'natural laws' are perfectly balanced and just, even if harsh.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Ninth Commandment: Worship Death, the Perdition of All, abandon all secular bonds
structure_content.summary: Death is heralded as the 'greatest initiator and redeemer' of the awakened soul, a 'spiritualisation' of form and a 'birth in spirit.' It's not a true end of existence but a transformation and return to darkness. The fear of death is seen as a sign of smallness; worshipping death leads to heroism and sacrifice, opening the 'road to eternity.' The 'black arms of Satan' unveil 'all existence beyond the gates of death.'

structure_content.chapter_title: The Tenth Commandment: Despise Humanity, make yourself one with the Master
structure_content.summary: This commandment critiques man-centered and egocentric thinking as a 'lie' that prevents reaching true humanity. 'Humanity' is a 'middle step' between animal and god. The 'archetypal man' is an image of 'God' (perfection of spirit). By abandoning 'herd-mentality' and embracing 'super-humanity,' one becomes 'Creator and destroyer, God and Satan, Adam and Christ,' passing through the gates of 'Nun and Shin' to make the world 'whole, perfect.' It involves 'killing one's temporal personality' to step onto the path of true life and spiritual rebirth.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Commandments - A Path of Wisdom
structure_content.summary: The commandments are 'instructions' for following 'the black and narrow path of Master Satan' towards greater truth and strength. They are not for happiness or a life without suffering (objectives of the weak) but for the 'brave, proud' individuals for whom 'suffering and damnation' are a reward. The true love within is the wish to unite with 'nothingness' and die for nature, with Master Satan holding the keys to the One Soul/Spirit.

structure_content.chapter_title: Credo
structure_content.summary: This section provides the Luciferian credo, a statement of belief in 'Satan Bright, Falsely Condemned' (the Paradox and Spirit of Destruction), 'the Antichrist' (Son of Satan's Spirit, Conceived by Great Knowledge, Born of This World, Who Lives and Rules in Final Days, Is Crowned, Goes to War and Shall Victor, Leads the World to Death, And Elevates It to the Brilliance of Darkness), and 'the Holy Hatred' (The Order of the Deniers of God, The Curse of Damnation, The Self-Chosen Punishment, And Eternal Death). It concludes with 'Verily.'

structure_content.chapter_title: The First Creed: I Believe in Satan
structure_content.summary: Belief here signifies intellectual conviction and comprehensive study, not blind hope. Satan is described as a 'bright one' whose 'fall is metaphorical,' his 'mask' (evil, suffering) born from human error. The 'best picture' of Satan is likened to god Shiva (Hinduism), representing creation/destruction, fertility/virginity, vitality/annihilation, and patronage of yogis, an amalgamation of opposites.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Second Creed: And the Antichrist
structure_content.summary: Christ and Antichrist are 'manifestations of great souls.' Christ brings new revelation; Antichrist destroys old. Both follow the 'Triple Key' development plan. The Antichrist represents the 'manasic aspect' (intellectual Ego) of divinity, emphasizing intellect and understanding to destroy the old world. His work necessitates 'great knowledge' (even if it involves dissension and lower manas over-development) to achieve destruction.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Third Creed: And the Holy Hatred
structure_content.summary: On the Left Hand Path, divinity is learned through sublimation and purification of hate. 'Holy hatred' is a 'straight sword of truth' striking down falsehood and pettiness within oneself. Purified hate becomes a 'diamond-thunderbolt.' The 'Order of the Deniers of God' must first deny God's truth in all religions to find Him within themselves and nature, reaching a more majestic understanding of God than old believers. 'The Curse of Damnation' is the voluntary death of one's former self, involving 'inner crucifixion' and accepting everyday torment to awaken the 'uncreated' self. 'Eternal Death' is understood as transformation and return to the uncreated darkness, leading to immortality through conscious 'dying at every moment.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Magister Noster
structure_content.summary: This section provides a Luciferian version of the Lord's Prayer in Latin, addressed to 'Magister noster, qui es in corde meo' (Our Master, who art in my heart). It prays for His virtue and kingdom to come, asks for 'supersubstantial agony,' forgiveness of 'debts' (psychological deficits), and liberation from the flesh, concluding with 'Amen.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Article One: Our Master, Who Art in the Heart of Mine
structure_content.summary: The master worshipped is 'bright Satan,' residing in the heart and head as a magical center. Prayer is not groveling but a rite for 'concentration of the soul,' aiming for 'Unio Mystica' where servant and served are one. This practice (mantra-, bhakti-, and gnana yoga) builds likelihood with the Master. The body is seen as an 'excellent instrument' for the spirit's work.

structure_content.chapter_title: Article Two: Hallowed be Thy Virtue, Thy Kingdom Come
structure_content.summary: Worship is directed at the 'NAME' and 'virtue' (qualitative essence) of the master, identified as 'Holy' and 'prime darkness.' The coming of the 'kingdom' means the manifestation of 'Holy Darkness' in the material world, through the 'spiritualising breath of death,' leading forms to the 'Final Perfection of formlessness.' Satan is described as 'logic itself,' the 'most untraditional perfection of understanding,' embodying both Potency and Virtue in his infinite circumference.

structure_content.chapter_title: Article Three: Darkness Come in the Name of the Most Prudent Light of Reason
structure_content.summary: This section reiterates the 'incomparability' of Darkness, equating it with 'Lux rationis augustissimae' (pure, unbent light of Lucifer, the 'Lightbringer'). This sacred intelligence and knowledge of immortality were the basis for Jehovah's curse. The goal is to return the curse to Jehovah and raise Lucifer, the 'archangel of intelligence,' to power. Embracing darkness (that which existed before light, enabling understanding, foundation of change) allows 'contradiction and chaos' to open a 'new age of equilibrium.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Article Four: Grant us Today our Spiritual Affliction
structure_content.summary: Spiritual affliction is valued as instrumental for self-development and expansion, separating from material illusions. The destructive element in the world is crude; true 'spiritual conception' of suffering involves controlled devotion to destruction. Noble warrior-spirit and heroic death are affirmed, but violence is seen as an 'abuse of power.' The method of channeling wrath is through 'thoughts of wonderful magic' and making 'feelings as flawless crystal' so the Master's power streams through cleansed instruments, eliminating 'bain pictures of useless humanity.' This is seen as 'abstract concepts' directed dynamism.

structure_content.chapter_title: Article Five: And Forgive us our debts as We forgive our debters
structure_content.summary: This 'prayer' for 'forgiveness of debt' refers not to sin or monetary debt but to 'psychological deficit' or 'subconscious magnetic charge' (karma) from internal programming. To break these 'crammed psychological harnesses,' one must let go of 'selfish bitterness' towards others, purifying the 'inner judge' (Diabolos/Accuser). This inner judge's 'judgment' is 'without mercy and thoroughly just,' holding the 'sword of harmo' sharpened on both sides.

structure_content.chapter_title: Article Six: Lead us not into Vanity but Deliver us from Flesh
structure_content.summary: This request is for strength and clarity of vision to resist the 'vanity' and 'repulsive life-liquid' of everyday material life, which lacks 'spirituality,' 'intelligence,' and the 'ideal.' 'Flesh' represents the 'lower material' psychology that distorts reality. The ultimate aim is to turn glance away from matter, reaching through forms to the 'infinity of the abyss' for 'unbound strength.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Of Lucifer's Sacraments
structure_content.summary: Sacraments are not seen as irrational escapism but as 'practise and study of the occult sciences,' termed 'Magic – the Great Science.' These are tools for the Spirit to operate in matter, transforming and spiritualizing to complete the 'Grand Work.' Even Christian sacraments are seen to have originally rooted in sacred spiritual services, e.g., Baptism as cleansing emotional nature and rising above illusions.

structure_content.chapter_title: Of Demons
structure_content.summary: Demons are described as 'spirits of nature,' neither good nor evil, formless to emotions but visible to a clairvoyant, acting as 'concrete, executive forces' in magic. Man is a magician, with Satan as the source of strength and absolute Spirit. An aware magician sees this 'entire circle as unbroken' and uses different classes of spirits for specific tasks. Daimons follow the currents of human will; 'purity, solidity, clarity and irresistibility' are synonymous with magic and an 'actuated stream of energy.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Of Magic
structure_content.summary: Magic involves a 'power' that governs creation, transformation, and destruction, which is the 'unrecognised will' emanating from the 'feminine abyss.' This force, also called 'love' (devoid of lower emotional connotations), is equivalent to 'nuclear energy' and the 'primal force of the 'Sun'' (theosophical atma). A developed human soul can harness this force to achieve omniscience and omnipotence. The 'pentagram' is a tool to command this force. The 'core point' in all creatures connects to archetypal forces of the Spirit, a 'gate' to new worlds, accessed through relentless devotion and purity of soul.

structure_content.chapter_title: Of the Responsibility of the Individual
structure_content.summary: The text emphasizes 'individual responsibility' for actions, emotions, intentions, and convictions, rejecting 'subinstinctive redemption.' Man is accountable even for 'idle words.' The Luciferian moral code is that everyone should do and think what they 'truly want to attach Himself' to, with true moral actions judged by 'motivation' and 'honesty.' Harm to others gathers 'poison' to one's own system. The 'darkness' is presented as the 'purest, truest light of all.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Of Satan
structure_content.summary: Satan is fundamentally 'dual,' representing both what 'should' and 'should not be embodied,' an 'inner and outward half.' He is likened to 'God himself,' an 'enormous essence' that 'blazes upon us power which is not in itself good or bad but rather above all moral.' His 'amorality' (not immorality) includes 'perfect wisdom, perfect love, perfect will.' His 'mask' (selfishness, cruelty) is the 'farthest border' for those who cannot grasp his true essence. The challenge is to manifest his power through the 'key' of understanding to avoid astray.

key_concepts.definition: The philosophy of the Left Hand Path emphasizing self-knowledge, spiritual freedom, and the attainment of divinity through inner revelation and experience, rather than external dogma.

The absolute, monistic Spirit; the inner ideal, a god-like creature, an individualized fragment of deep Knowledge and Power, the holy archangel who elevates mankind from ignorance. He is the Son who allows the Father (Abyss) to be seen, embodying both creation and destruction like Shiva.

The eternal source of all Meaning, Truth, Love, Will, and Strength; the only unspoiled reality beyond forms. It is the Father, the ultimate perfection, and the destination of spiritual evolution. It is also the 'prime darkness' and 'brilliance' from which all understanding arises.

The final destination of man, the occult process of development to rediscover and incarnate Master Satan, thereby perfecting an immortal personality and returning to a state of pure omniscience and connection with the Spirit itself. It involves transforming and spiritualizing matter through magical practice.

A manifestation of a great soul, representing the 'manasic aspect' (intellectual Ego) of divinity. The Antichrist's mission is to destroy corrupt and non-adaptable old cultures and make way for new ones through intellect and understanding, even necessitating 'great knowledge' and destruction.

A purified and sublimated form of hate, directed not at individuals but at the 'false government of the world and its blind creator,' and at falsehood/pettiness within oneself. It acts as a 'straight sword of truth' and a 'diamond-thunderbolt' for spiritual purification and transformation.

The veneration of death not as an end, but as the 'greatest initiator and redeemer' of the awakened soul. It is a process of spiritualization, transformation, and a 'birth in spirit,' leading to heroism, sacrifice, and the opening of the path to eternity and the 'black arms of Satan' (the Uncreated Abyss).

The material world and its manifestations are considered imperfect, instrumental, and illusionary. They are 'limited shreds of formal tissue' and products of the 'Creator, the great deceiver,' which bind souls and obscure true Meaning. The goal is to transcend and abolish the world of forms.

A fundamental requirement for magical and spiritual progress. It refers to purity of motive, intention, and soul, cleansed from 'selfish bitterness,' 'emotionally impure sexuality,' and attachment to material vanity. Purity is synonymous with 'solidity, clarity, and irresistibility' in magic.

The practical application of occult sciences to harness natural and spiritual forces. It is the ability to direct purified thought and will to sculpt matter, interact with spirits/demons, and achieve spiritual transformation. It is the active side of the 'feminine abyss' and involves understanding purification and connecting opposites.

Not merely sin, but a 'psychological deficit' or 'subconscious magnetic charge' resulting from internal programming and previous actions. It binds individuals to predetermined outcomes and requires purification of the 'inner judge' (Diabolos/Accuser) by letting go of selfish bitterness.

Latin for 'The most august light of reason,' used to describe the pure, unbent light of Lucifer, the 'Lightbringer,' which is equivalent to the sacred intelligence and knowledge of immortality found in the 'Darkness.'

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined in 'The Catechism of Lucifer' is a demanding path of philosophical self-transformation and occult development, aimed at achieving 'super-humanity' and ultimate union with the 'Uncreated Abyss' or 'Spirit.' It is a journey of 'individuation' that requires the conscious destruction of limiting forms, including one's former self and conventional beliefs. The system emphasizes rigorous internal work through the internalization and adherence to a specific set of Luciferian 'commandments' and 'creeds,' which fundamentally invert conventional morality and spiritual goals. This process involves intellectual understanding (gnosis), emotional and spiritual purification, and the deliberate harnessing of inner and external forces through magical practice. The ultimate goal is to become 'one with the Master,' incarnating one's inner divinity and realizing 'pure omniscience and omnipotence.'
tools: Intellect and Understanding (Manas): Crucial for discerning truth, rejecting dogma, and conceptualizing the Luciferian gnosis. The Antichrist represents this manasic aspect.

Purified Will and Intention: The driving force behind magical work and self-transformation. A 'purified will' directed at its source is described as 'marvellous and unstoppable.' Purity of motive and devotion are paramount.
Gnosis / Cognition: Deep inner knowledge and self-awareness, leading to the recognition of one's inner divinity and connection to the universal Spirit.

Purity of Soul / Self: The state of being free from 'selfish bitterness,' 'psychological deficits,' and attachments to material illusions. This allows the Spirit to operate through the individual without distortion.
The Sacred Triple Key: A conceptual framework for spiritual development, though not explicitly defined in the provided text beyond its role in guiding the work of Christ and Antichrist.

Occult Sciences / Magic: A systematic body of knowledge and practices for interacting with and manipulating spiritual and material forces. These are 'tools through which the Spirit may operate in matter.'
Self-Reflection and Contemplation: Essential for internalizing the philosophy, understanding the 'laws of the invisible world,' and continuously evaluating one's progress on the path.
rituals: Regular recitation and internalization of the 'Magister Noster' prayer for soul concentration and achieving 'Unio Mystica' (unity with the Master). This is framed as a form of mantra-, bhakti-, and gnana yoga.

Conscious adherence to 'The Ten Commandments' and 'The Creeds' as a 'path of wisdom' and a 'self-chosen punishment' (inner crucifixion), which involves systematic self-overcoming and rejection of conventional values.

Purification of Hate: Directing intense, 'Holy Hatred' against the perceived 'Creator,' the 'false government of the world,' and the 'imperfection of forms' to cleanse one's own being and purify intention, avoiding physical violence.

Purification of Lust: Sublimating sexual energy from 'form-breeding sexuality' to a 'magical and controlled ability' for the soul, moving beyond 'emotionally impure sexuality' to aid in the 'abolishing of the world of forms.'
Cultivation and embrace of 'Sacred Darkness' and 'Brilliance of Darkness' through contemplative and intellectual understanding, recognizing these as the true nature of Spirit and ultimate reality.

Practicing 'Death Worship': Mentally and spiritually 'dying' to the material world, former self, and all 'secular bonds' to undergo a process of 'spiritualization' and achieve 'birth in spirit,' opening the path to eternity.

Magical Operations: Employing 'Magic' as 'The Great Science' to sculpt matter and influence reality through purified thought, focused will, and interaction with 'spirits of nature' (demons). This involves channeling a 'magnetic, invisible, devastating fire' and activating 'actuated streams of energy' through precise intention and inner purity. The 'pentagram' is mentioned as a tool for commanding forces.

relevant_quotes.text: For in Luciferian gnosis, the philosophy of the Left Hand Path, the most important thing is the freedom of one's own spiritual Ego.
The fear of God is not the beginning of wisdom bnt rather great selfishness. If we believe in a Christian God, a cruel and despotic Jehovah, we have no choice bnt to hate him for his tyranny.
Master Satan is man himself, immortal, wise, a god-like creature, an individualised fragment of that deep Knowledge and Power that shall forever remain in the perfection of the Abyss.
"Satan is the most absolute and truthful manifestation of the Absolute God."
Every son mnst kill his father, before he can become that father in the long process of the true individnalisation.

"Magical power is brought about by understanding purification, and connecting opposites, and is thus a most crucial feature of our world view, the common denominator of all our work. Magic is about travelling on the Path. Magic is devotion, knowledge, power, and creation. It is the channelling of a magnetic, invisible, devastating fire. It is the initiation of a new form. It is the creation and evocation of the self. It is the perfect connection with Nature in the highest meaning of this term.”

The true love within ns is the gentle wish to unite with nothingness and to die for nature that in its myriad formations jerks itself around like a mute beast in chains. Behind all of its souls there is One Soul, one Spirit, and Master Satan holds the keys to Its presence.

critical_analysis.relevance: 'The Catechism of Lucifer' is a significant text within contemporary Western Esotericism, particularly for its explicit articulation of an anti-nomian, individualistic, and deeply philosophical Luciferianism. It is relevant for challenging mainstream religious and occult dogmas by reinterpreting core Judeo-Christian concepts (catechism, commandments, creeds, prayer) through a Luciferian lens. This recontextualization provides a sophisticated theological framework for self-deification, gnosis, and spiritual liberation from perceived material and conceptual limitations. Its unique contribution lies in its fusion of Gnostic, Theosophical, and Hermetic concepts, presenting Satan/Lucifer not as a literal evil entity but as an archetypal force representing knowledge, intellect, the Uncreated Abyss, and the 'Inner Master.' The book positions suffering and destruction (of old forms) as necessary catalysts for spiritual evolution, distinguishing its path from both hedonistic Satanism and conventional spiritual paths. It offers a dense, theoretical, and practical system for radical self-transformation, emphasizing internal purity, conscious will, and magical operative work.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for 'The Catechism of Lucifer' is advanced practitioners and serious students of Western Esotericism, specifically those interested in the Left Hand Path, Luciferian philosophy, Gnosticism, and Hermetic traditions. It appeals to individuals seeking a rigorous, intellectually demanding, and anti-dogmatic spiritual path focused on self-mastery, gnosis, and spiritual evolution. The text is not intended for casual readers or those seeking simplistic answers, as indicated by the author's emphasis on critical 'absorption and consideration' rather than blind acceptance. Its dense philosophical language and inversion of traditional morality make it suitable for those already familiar with occult concepts and prepared to engage with profoundly challenging ideas about divinity, ethics, and self-realization.
